-Individuals who cannot work because of an injury caused as a direct result of the disaster. 

Pennsylvanians whose employment is impacted should file a claim online at http://www.uc.pa.gov.

-Individuals who were to begin employment but were prevented doing so by the disaster. 

-Individuals who became the major support for a household because of the death of the head of the household as a result of the disaster.

-DUA benefits are only available for individuals, including those self-employed, who are unemployed as a direct result of Hurricane Ida remnants.

-Individuals unable to reach their job b/c they must travel through affected area and are unable to do so because of the disaster.

If your employment was impacted as a direct result of Hurricane Ida remnants, you are strongly encourage to apply for these benefits. 

Eligibility for DUA assistance:
-You must live, work, or have to travel through impacted areas to reach work.

HURRICANE IDA UPDATE:
Pennsylvanians who live or work in one of the 6 counties impacted by remnants of Hurricane Ida are now eligible to apply for temporary Disaster Unemployment Assistance (DUA), thanks to the federal Department of Labor and the Wolf Administration.

In January, Democrats turned the Child Tax Credit into a monthly payment without any requirement that able-bodied adults be required to work. Now Democrats want to go further and no longer require that the children eligible for these monthly payments be US citizens.

It caters to elitist universities. Wealthy universities have for too long used their endowments like tax-exempt hedge funds, raking in tax-free investments & hoarding cash. Democrats hope to repeal a tax on these endowments enacted by legislation from the previous administration.

This bill includes tax hikes for family farms and small businesses. Democrats want to create a double death tax that will force even more farms and businesses to be sold off to corporate conglomerates so the families can pay Uncle Sam.

The #WomenVetsTaskForce thanks Captain Graciela Tiscareño-Sato for her service to our country! #HispanicHeritageMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_2IesQVIAEZQ6l.jpg

After her military career, Captain Tiscareño-Sato founded a publishing, marketing, and communications firm. She is also an award-winning author for her books, which highlight the work of Latina and Hispanic American women in the military. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_2Hr-eVEAA5ie2.jpg

For their combat air operations, then-First Lieutenant Tiscareño-Sato and her crew earned the Air Medal. This happened 10 months before Congress lifted the Combat Exclusion Law that barred women from being assigned to combat duties. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_2H1wdVgBUjIF3.jpg
On her first deployment to Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, she was a member of one of the first aircrews to patrol and enforce the no-fly zone in Southern Iraq after the conclusion of Operation Desert Storm.

During her career, Captain Tiscareño-Sato flew for thousands of hours and taught as an instructor. She spent almost 10 years in active duty, where she was a navigator and instructor. During her service, Captain Tiscareño-Sato also earned her Master’s in International Management. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_2IV41VUAAwJJr.jpg

This week, we are highlighting Captain Graciela Tiscareño-Sato, one of the first women to fly combat missions for the @usairforce and the first Latina recipient of the Air Medal. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_2HjiYVIAYH01s.png
During #HispanicHeritageMonth, the #WomenVetsTaskForce is celebrating the historic contributions of Latina and Hispanic American #womenvets.

After Watergate, Congress took action. 

Passing a series of landmark laws to prevent a future president from abusing their office the way Richard Nixon did.

Those reforms stood the test of time for half a century. 

Now we must act once again to protect our democracy.

The Protecting Our Democracy Act is designed to: 

Restore our system of checks and balances. 

Create greater accountability and transparency. 

Protect our elections from foreign interference.

Today, I introduced a major reform bill to ensure that no future president can do the kind of damage Trump did to our democracy. Ever again.

The Protecting Our Democracy Act is an ambitious set of reforms that would give us better protection.

We must seize this moment.
